While the concept of League is standard and executed "decently"(More upon this later). Its community is purely toxic, and some of their characters don't show much skill as it's "predictions" but hard to dodge. Small things like these might be called "part of the game", but it really doesn't help this game. This game is solely focused on mental health rather than any skill. If you're mentally able, you'll find that some of the players you play against are super easy, but that's because they are in a bad mindset where this game truly shows its fangs in the community. Now while I said it was executed decently, the flaws in this game are apparent once you play. One of the first problems is the fact that you HAVE to play with your teammates until the game is over, or you surrender. Otherwise, you get penalized. Having to stick with toxic players is bad, but not the worst of things. However, even if your power went out, or your router died. You'd still get punished, even when it's casual. Also, you can lose out on prizes even if you rejoin back. Secondly, its community/foundation. Its community is comprised of people who are either toxic and can't work(very worst outcome) to very good and can work. However, most people can't work together as their roles start mixing or they want to talk a certain part of the map(game mechanics). The game mechanics are based on 5 classes. Each having their own role/lane. Most of the game is based on the balance of these. However, because some people are bad, the entire balance of the game will be thrown. Probably the most annoying part of "LoL" is its characters. Its characters are not very fair to anyone. You can be highly skilled but lose to a basic player who has a better character.

The game itself is not the issue.The way the company handles the immense toxicity of the community is the issue. Every single ranked game, and I mean every single one, at least one player calls for another player to be reported. The report culture in this game is debilitating for a routine player. In most situations the player is not worthy of being reported as they have done nothing wrong but been less skilled at the game than the reporter. I have seen in time and time again when a player is behaving perfectly fine but still receives a report from the team just for a low score. Getting enough reports in one game will give you an INSTANT BAN. This is done instantly by a system there is no review whatsoever. This means that the players that are doing the reporting have the power and there is no limit on how many people you report. I have seen players who just report the entire team when they lose a game or 3 man flex teams who will target report one specific player just to get them automatically banned by the system. Riot does not reduce ban lengths even for players who were banned without review. I was chatbanned for 25 games just for calling a player who was intentionally feeding ( a score of 0/22/0) a crybaby. This ban was given to me instantaneously and with no review whatsoever. When I sent in a support ticket to Riot Games not only does it take forever for them to get back to you their responses are extremely unprofessional as well. My response was one of sympathy for my situation and the support agent even expressed willingness to reduce my ban 'if he could'. Which only further proves how absolutely abysmal the automatic ban feature is. STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME !!! MOST TOXIC COMMUNITY THE WORLD HAS EVER SEEN !!!

League is at the same time the best and worst game you will ever play. At first, it is the most marvellous experience the abundance of champions and lore about them is sure to keep you entertained for hours and hours. It's an infinite learning simulator where every little improvement gives you an immense return but that's the good part...This game will make you love it just so little by little it can tear you down..If you choose to take it serious it will frustrate you, drive you insane and enrage you at any corner...The overloaded kits, the player base, the publisher, the game itself it will make a huge dent in you as a person... It will make you a worse human being and the worst part is that once you've reached this threshold it's almost impossible to quit because you long for that same feeling you felt when you first started playing. In conclusion, do not under any circumstance play this game, the short time benefit and happiness are not at all worth the long term damge.

I LOVED this game, But when i get matched with people in ranked who have the following mindsets: "You don't deserve this win", "GG (at 5 mins in), "Uninstall", or anything really that is not positive; it is IMPOSSIBLE to enjoy this game.  I don't care to lose as long as I know my team is trying 100% of the time and we did everything.  THAT IS NEVER the case especially in lower ELO (Where I am currently stuck due to the aformentioned reasons above).  I KNOW that I am a better player than what I am getting matched with and I know I am WAY better than just silver.  I want to learn more about where I should be rather than find out no matter how much a research this game and find was "SHOULD" work for the situation and just decide to go full damage and carry myself out from the support role.  WHY is it impossible to climb.  I don't need a pay to win coach to get out of this elo.  I KNOW how to get out, but when people are deliberately losing games or being toxic for the sake of self-satisfaction of ruining someones game, I CANT DO IT!  Even if I know we can win the game and we are far behind others DO NOT believe in their own skill or trust anyone to win the game. So tell me how I am supposed to enjoy the benefits of any buffs/nerfs to the game when the result is always the same? WHY.  I Put so much effort and take breaks and still F***ing lose the same EVERY. F***ing.  TIME!  This is the ONLY game I play and I love it, but I cant enjoy it if my teammates cant get past their egos and play as a team.  You think we enjoy this game because we can play with our friends?  INCORRECT.  We enjoy this game because it gives us a special time to shine and beat the sh** outta other players knowing we are better and smarter.  Other games Ive played have never offered this feeling of power (the healthy kind).  It shouldnt matter what anyone picks in the game as long as they are good and can build to the conditions of the match (Which I do most of the time).  But as a nearly 10-year member of this game, I am getting matched with players that are asking why an AP assassin does so much damage to them and come to find out they REFUSE to build magic resistances or ward effectively.  I get theres new people everyday, but there is absolutely NO CONSISTENCY in how I am getting matched or people that care about winning the game at all costs as I do.  Im sorry I have not experienced this.  Yes, statistically we cant win EVERY game, but you can win MORE if you try to get out of the tough situation rather than say "GG" and the rest of your team surrenders leaving you alone knowing you could've done something.  MARK MY WORDS RIOT, I will quit this game entirely and tell others not to try it for the sake of their mental sanity and worth as a online player.  This game is fun when you are matched with more people that care in ranked.  I dont want to be matched with people that are not fit to play ranked games.  Thats why normals exists. But b/c you all watch the pros and they exist players are trying things they KNOW they cant play and are trying it out in ranked just because someone said it was "OP" Rather than building on the knowledge they acquired through extensive research of the game and trust in their own ability to play whatever champion suits them.  But Ive discovered, I cannot even enjoy my picks because I am being ridiculed because its something someone else didn't like or they are just glued to one play style.  But thats the difference between me and the rest of the players.  I know what I do works , but I cant ever get to a point where i am useful enough to prove it because the screen says " Your team has agreed to surrender".  That is demoralizing.  And i have seen this too many times to count and I will NOT stand for this anymore!  I want to play knowing the others care enough to at least stay in the game to try.  This "I have calculated we will lose" is BULLSH**!  So what, they may mess up and we could win.  Yet, you put the "Hostage" option as a report.  Thats the DUMBEST thing to ever happen in this game.  Some people do like to hold others "Hostage". But if you have the mentality that you run away from a game you find "Unplayable" then you  should NOT be wasting your time playing ranked.  SURRENDER should NEVER be an option.  You don't see the pros do it! Yet that the biggest thing the players dont follow.  PLAY TO THE VERY END.   I could go on for EONS about how much my experience has changed negatively especially when I lose a game.  This review is not out of spite after losing a match.  This is a culmination of anger, disgust, regret, and most of all depression and oppression over the years with this game.  I should NOT be losing games I know I can win with my knowledge and I should be having MORE fun regardless of the result.  I have not felt happy about this game in years.  Let that sink in.  Sadly this is the only game i can turn to for gaming bc i invested so much time in it to be a successful player.  Summoner -Demacian Impact

Incredibly unhappy with customer service.First of all, let me get it straight that I am an advocate of the game. I greatly enjoy the game and have spent many hours enjoying it with my friends. I have had my account since around about 2012/2013 (not too sure) and have been a fan of the game, lore and (at times) the community.Rewind to late October 2016,I had a long period of inactivity in which I did not play the game due to work and university responsibilities. After reconnecting contact with one of my LoL playing friends, I decided to reinstall the game and take part in the halloween event.After installation, I attempted to log in and found that my account had been suspended permanently, at this point, I'm wondering why, as I've had a whole year or so out of the game.I log in to my web acount to find game history with the account for the past 30 days. I immediately opened a support ticket in hopes of finding out what had happened. Customer support informed me that my account had been used for exploits or hacks. I of course do not condone of such game-altering factors and have spent a fair amount of money on the game, So i'd not wish to see my account closed.I requested to know what IP address had logged into my account at the time of the exploits/hacks, to which they did not respond appropriately. I received several responses along the lines of "We've banned the account for scripts,hacks or exploits" without explaining further. I was then informed that sharing my account of any kind is against the TOS.My account has never been shared and at this point I'm certain that my account has been compromised, I treid to explain to the support agents who responded that my account needed further investigation, as I would like to prove that my account had indeed been compromised and needed reinvestigation. They would not respond appropriately.I had tried to mention that my account could not be properly secured as I received no notification of access to my account, nor do they currently offer a 2-step verification process to help secure accounts.I requested to have the issue escalated to a supervisor or higher, but I have not received a response since. The last message I sent was on November 2nd 2016.

The games total garbage now. I've been around since season 1 but I think I'm finally done. I've been up and down the ladder in ranked but it's so stupidly rigged now that can't actually climb at the proper speed or get placed where you belong.For the people that don't know, the game basically sets you up with teams for you to win or lose ahead of time. Your rarely in a position to impact the game. This means if you que up for a game right now. The game will decide if it wants you to win or lose beforehand. If it wants you to win you will get way better team mates then the other team. If it wants you to lose you end up with an impossible to win with team. You and all your practice and skill mean nothing to the system.Then there's player behavior, someone can intentionally and blatantly ruin your and your teams game. This means dieing over and over and doing nothing besides running around. That person will be free to do that forever. Riot won't take proper action against them. AND you won't be compensated for their nonsense. So say goodbye to a half hour of time and ranked score you'll never get back. And it's going to happen a memorable amount of times.To top it all off, if you don't get lucky in your placement matches you can end up in a ranked division that's going to take forever to climb out of because of how the above system now works. So even if you belong in Plat, if you got placed in Bronze, you'll have to grind for roughly 100 hours to get to where you should have been all along despite being better then the people your playing with because the system doesn't actually care when it matchmakes. It just decides if you've won or lost to many games. And it makes it so it takes as long as possible.If they fix the matchmaking so it's fun again and fair, and also take some sort of actual action against trash players the game is better off without, like a zero tolerance policy. We might have a winner again. Till then games on a downward spiral.P.S The new player experience is worse then ever. That's a whole other thing to deal with.

So...  Where should i start.I've been playing this game since season 3.Although i never could get into higher than D1, I've had some inside views of the game. First of all congrats for the visualization and the music team backwards on, for the SR remake and Pentakill (still one of my favourite albums).Secondary...The pace and the aim of the game has change very much over the few years... (There's a riot introducing shortfilm on netflix, highly recommending it). From that we know, how small the riot company was when it first had the idea of a wow-dota crossover moba game. Its aim was to make a game that players could enjoy, and make great inventions of champions, items comboes, etc. In comparison what you see nowadays is 4 tanks in a game, or a Kayle/Kassadin. And you know you're gonna loose, cause your team responds with "tg" to some useful guidance and your job as a laner is meaningless, cause you might get then into 0/10, they feed him and eventually he carries the game down. So you go into a game and even at the loading screen you can see that it's gonna waste 20-40 minutes of your life. Try to not get frustrated! And for this, obviously, the biggest part of the community, the low-elo players are insanely toxic and tryharding, cause they get and ego boost by playing broken, unbalanced champ, unkownly forcing them to tryhard even more, and ruin the casual experience of the game. Every 4/5 games you'll get a troll/afk/afk farm, etc. for the reasons i've mentioned above.Tertiary:So you have (about) 155 champs, right? Then may i get a reason why i can only see 20-25 of them no matter how many games i play? Again: Tryharding. But the saddest part is that they are broken in EVERY aspect of the game. When a kassadin, a late game champ can oneshot you in early game, and you are useless against him as an AD assassin, or hen fiora, the model of anti tank is useless against tanks (we'll get to it later, at the items), or when an adc's most broken way is getting it to ap. Just why. I know it looks cool in the LCS and WCS, but we don't have that type of level, and it's boring here.Quaternary: The items. I get it. I have 5k hours in league, 6k in WoW, I do know how a constant change is important to a game. But as in everything else, quality over quantity. And I accept that you've wanted the most out of the game, but is this surely the way? When tanks become gods only with one item, immobilized adc's get a mobility, so you can't even outplay them while they are destroying youm or an item that doubles the dmg buff of conqueror, so you can't properly 1v1 that particular champ. I can only visualize it with wow. World of Warcraft BfA had a lot of changes, half of the playerbase quit the game. Howewer, WoD had half of the changes, players still enjoyed their raids and dungeons, because they were one of the best ones in wow history (as always, pardon for the exceptions, and i can't speak in anyone's name, these are my own reviews and observations).(These are going to be my own oppinions.)Quinary: The gamemodes. I realyl like what you've did with Odyssey. In fact, that's my favourite gamemode in lol. and yet, You only see one for all and Urf. and not even Arurf, to motivate people to think and get creative with their given situation, no. Same bans, same picks everytime. Like a ranked without LP but with the same frustration and tryhard. Boring. as everything, Odyssey had its meta builds for questing, but with the perks and the items, the customization, you had PLENTY of choices and ways to make it entertaining. splash-hit malphite, rocket-bomber jinx, etc. It forced the players to think. and that was great. now in the shop, you get the recommended item to oyur face with a 1920*1080 size. Way to keep the motivation to think low...I'm quitting after many years of fun. I really liked your game. But that's the past.Au revoir.

This game isn't even worth playing anymore. I've been a fan for several years, and can safely say that I no longer am. First, it's impossible to climb. Riot's matchmaking ignores stats and win rates and will pair you with anybody no matter what the skill level. This will put higher elo players into games where they have to carry players just goofing off. There's no way to be competitive. Second, matchmaking will put a solo queue player in groups of 2 or more, and then your lane will wind up getting ganged up on all game because your own team is too busy with their buddies to pay attention to you.Most of the games you are thrown into will have people literally testing every nerve you have with constant chat log abuse, name calling, blaming, and blatantly sitting in the base for 20 minutes while your team is forced into unfair situation.After years of complaints, patience tested, and the inability to actually have fun playing for the last year---I'm done with it. I can spend my money on something else more enjoyable than this PoS cash grab.To make matters worse, Riot has claimed they are fixing most of these issues---yet, it's only a ploy because they know they are on the verge of losing their entire fan base to toxic people who only play to ruin the fun of the game. Sorry, Riot. I'm done with you guys.Signed. A pro.

-Que Times- Autofill has ruined this game. people want to play what they que for but the system says screw all that. In the interests of "faster que times" the system takes 10 secs to find a 2 players that pick their role and then 3 other random people and says you can fill these slots. It doesn't even do a good job of selecting which players get get their roles.  I just had a game where the system put 2 top mains 2 sup mains and an ADC main on the same team. I got top the other top main was forced mid. One play got support and the other was forced jungle. Neither of these players knew their role and it showed. In  a RANKED game I have to play with players that do not know what they are doing and its no wonder we lost.  I am plat Elo my average que time are between 30 secs -3 mins. This is fast the problem is you are giving up the quality of your teammates for fast que times. it use to be the que times were too long now they are a shorter but you are getting put with autofill players every game. So the system finds players fast but it doesn't care who it picks. It just grabs a handful of players at random and says here is your team. So the system gaslights you about your "chosen" roles and just puts you where ever to make sure ques times stay low. Matchmaking- The MMR system is rigged ranked. When you are on winning streaks it feels like the system says oh you think you are good well prove it. Here are 4 players that are either off role/first timing champs/trolling/ AFk/ Etc. now carry them. When you do well the system not only puts you against better players but pairs you with worse players. The MMR system wants to keep everyone as close to %50 Win rate as possible. Feels like a crooked carnival. Coin flip matchmaking. -Champion balance- What should balance mean? Riot pushes the narrative that they want every champion to be balanced at a %50 win rate. They advertise that league is a game that you can pick any champ build any items and express yourself however you want but yet why are there champions that have consistent 47% win rate with 1.8% pick rate? Because its all a lie. Balance and meta is artificial. Riot picks and chooses which champions are going to be strong intentionally. This leaves champions in unplayable states for literal years until riot decides that its a bad champs turn to be broken. Balance patches happen every 2-4 weeks and still somehow champions remain unplayable. - Player to Developer communication- In short there is none. Riot removed the official league forums. They say reddit (a third party website)  is the only avenue for discussion. There is no direct way to voice concerns or issues. When issues are brought up on Reddit riot will respond condescendingly assuring you that they are smarter then you and know best. Except many issues that have been known for years never are addressed.  Every now and then you will get an in client message requesting feedback but its just multiple choice and the essay section where you can voice concerns  will never get read.Champions - The thematic and over all design of champs is great. The problem though is has power creep continues to climb the NEW champs are always extremely over powered.  Because they are so strong and people want to win you only ever see the same 25 champs . Out of 151 champions only 25 are picked consistently.  Talk about boring.  At this stage in the game every new champ that comes out fills a role or situation or is just a straight up better version of an existing champ. What is the point of having so many champions if some champs are just clearly better then the others. Toxicity - Because of all of the issues listed above toxicity exists. People get frustrated at this broken mess of a game and understandably lash out at other players. The match making system screws you with bad players, The client crashes and causes you to lose your promos, you champion sucks you can do nothing but pray that riot feels the same way . All of the leagues systems create frustration and because there is no outlet to express these frustrations players take it out on one another. Riot currently only cares about verbal toxicity because its easy to catch. All they do is set up a robot that when some one get reported the robot looks are the chat logo in game looks for "taboo" words and if they are found sends punishments. but it only catches those players if the auto detect system finds one of those words.  There is no context to this just a computer checking of boxes. The real toxicity is inting, Afk, trolling. these things cant be picked up on by a robot so they never get caught. but if you were to flame a person literally ruining your match and you call them a nono word oops looks like you get the ban not the game runnier. Riot has done nothing to stop this behavior.

I started playing league in July 2015, initially it was hard to learn, but i like a challenge, and i had friends who I played with who helped me get to grips with the game.I loved it. I still love parts of it, especially the world, and the characters (most, less so some of the recent ones)When I first played it was the first multiplayer online game I'd played, I'd heard about how toxic the community was but i could deal with being called names and being told to kms, although I was surprised when one player told me he did awful things to a child he held captive in his basement every time I'd kill him in game. I don't think I'll ever forget that game.My issue with the game is not the player base, many games have toxic players, and in general I think Riot do an ok job of dealing with toxicity, not a great job, but an ok job. Maybe less than ok, but I digress, my issue is that the people who make the game have no passion, playing it for 5 years, it's very easy to see exactly how the game has changed. LOL has gone from a passion project to a product, a 'game' with the aim to drain it's player base of as much money as it can, and again it shows. I've made multiple accounts throughout the years, and recently, on my newer accounts, I've been non stop advertised to by Riot within the client in a way I just wasn't when I made my first account back in 2015. 'Buy skins', 'Buy XP boosts', 'Buy stat tracking'. Guys, I've just made an account, I'm not gonna shell out ¬£50 on an account that's 2 minutes old. Stat tracking should not cost extra, ever, in any game. Ever.I used to describe league as fun, the first thing that comes to mind sadly when I think of LOL is 'money-grabbing'.I saw a review of League titled something like "I've never seen a game fall so far", and I think it's the truth. The people who make the client should be ashamed, as I write this, I'm in a 57 minute game queue, I'm not, but the client believes I am. Their client is full of bugs and issues, that they have no intention of resolving, once again because these issues do not affect their bottom line.This review has got very long....but this is my view of the game based on my experience, finally I will say, please Riot games, just give League of Legends to a games company who have passion for their work.Also your support staff is a joke, stop outsourcing your support, it does. not. work.

So if you're just wanting to play a game to relax and have fun, then look elsewhere.
